alert.note: Alert for West Slopes North Cascades and Passes; West Slopes North Central Cascades and Passes; West Slopes South Central Cascades and Passes (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 03 at 10:24AM PDT until April 05 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 8 AM PDT TUESDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 2500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 24 inches with 30 to 40 inches near the volcanoes of the North and South Cascades. * WHERE...Cascade mountains of Whatcom, Skagit, Snohomish, King, Pierce, and Lewis counties, including the Mount Baker Ski Area, Stevens Pass, Snoqualmie Pass, Crystal Mountain Ski Area, and Paradise on Mount Rainier. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 8 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Strong winds may also reduce visibility from blowing snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions in Washington state, call 5 1 1.
